meanings.definition: A brief electronic signal or sound.
meanings.sent1: The blipped on the screen indicated a new message.
meanings.sent2: I heard a blipped coming from the computer.
meanings.sent3: The blipped from the phone made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The blipped of the alarm woke me up suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The blipped of the microwave signaled that my popcorn was ready.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, short sound.
meanings.sent1: She blipped the horn to get the driver's attention.
meanings.sent2: The bird blipped as it flew away.
meanings.sent3: The toy blipped when she pressed the button.
meanings.sent4: His footsteps blipped on the quiet street.
meanings.sent5: The machine blipped loudly when it started up.

meanings.definition: To appear briefly or momentarily on a screen or radar.
meanings.sent1: The plane blipped on the radar before disappearing.
meanings.sent2: A red dot blipped on the monitor for a second.
meanings.sent3: The ghost blipped on the camera screen for a split second.
meanings.sent4: Her face blipped on the TV during the interview.
meanings.sent5: The shooting star blipped across the night sky.
